intro: Anemone motuoensis, commonly known as the Motuo anemone, is a striking flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the flowers consist of numerous petal-like sepals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
